How to Install cavepacker on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • cavepacker

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install cavepacker on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing cavepacker on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall cavepacker in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install cavepacker, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install cavepacker Using apt

To install cavepacker in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install cavepacker using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install cavepacker

The installation of cavepacker might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install cavepacker Using apt-get

To install cavepacker using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install cavepacker.

sudo apt-get -y install cavepacker

Install cavepacker Using Synaptic

To install cavepacker using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install cavepacker on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for cavepacker. This will display the cavepacker package in the package window, now to install cavepacker, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the cavepacker package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of cavepacker.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install cavepacker Using aptitude

To install cavepacker on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of cavepacker.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install cavepacker using the command aptitude install cavepacker.

sudo aptitude -y install cavepacker

How to Upgrade cavepacker on debian

If you want to upgrade the cavepacker package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade cavepacker using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade cavepacker to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade cavepacker.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade cavepacker sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade cavepacker

Upgrade cavepacker using Aptitude

To upgrade cavepacker using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade cavepacker.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade cavepacker

Upgrade cavepacker using Synaptic

To upgrade cavepacker using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for cavepacker, now right-click cavepacker, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade cavepacker just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall cavepacker on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall cavepacker from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just cavepacker, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove cavepacker

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of cavepacker

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of cavepacker you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge cavepacker

Remove cavepacker using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall cavepacker using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for cavepacker, right-click the cavepacker package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall cavepacker click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install cavepacker on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade cavepacker using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of cavepacker then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
